task_text: [Epidemiology][Summarization + Factual-Retrieval] Extract the case-surveillance indicators described by the WHO COVID-19 document and summarize how they inform containment measures.

gold_end_state.summary: WHO surveillance indicators include case counts, test positivity rates, hospitalizations, and signal-based genomic monitoring; these indicators guide containment by signaling when to scale testing, target interventions, and implement or relax non-pharmaceutical measures based on trends and capacity thresholds.

quiz.question: Which indicator helps assess if testing is adequate relative to spread?
